metadata.title: CVE-2021-29946 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
Ports that were written as an integer overflow above the bounds of a 16-bitinteger could have bypassed port blocking restrictions when used in theAlt-Svc header. This vulnerability affects Firefox ESR < 78.10, Thunderbird< 78.10, and Firefox < 88.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-29946` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 88.0+build2-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
firefox-geckodriver - 88.0+build2-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
firefox-mozsymbols - 88.0+build2-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '88.0+build2-0ubuntu0.16.04.1').
thunderbird: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needed').
